citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - Austin, TX - Distance to Parks

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research and Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract: This EnviroAtlas dataset shows the approximate walking distance up to 5000m from a park entrance at any given location within the EnviroAtlas community boundary. Park entrances were included in this analysis if they were within 5km of the community boundary. This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: The purpose of this dataset to support research purposes examining the effects of walking distance to parks on various outcomes at specific locations within the study area. This data can be assessed with other socio-economic factors to identify areas of need. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

overview.eaover: For more information about EnviroAtlas data, go to https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets. This dataset shows the estimated walking distance to a park entrance at any given location within the EnviroAtlas Community. The easiest way to obtain values for specific point locations using ArcGIS is to use the Extract Values to Points tool in the Spatial Analyst/Extraction toolbox. If a value of -9999 is returned for a point, that point is beyond the area where Natural Neighbor interpolation was valid. If a value of -8888 is returned for a point, that point is beyond 5000m from a park entrance. Technically, the difference between the -8888 and -9999 areas is that for the -8888 areas you could qualitatively say the nearest park entrance is �>5000m� away whereas for the -9999 values you can only say �Insufficient data� because those areas are beyond the area examined for park entrances. Processing steps completed using Python scripts. A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps.
